entry.content:
SO2, silicate clouds, but no CH4 detected in a warm Neptune

  • Achrne Dyrek
  • Michiel Min

entry.title: Computational prediction of complex cationic rearrangement outcomes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Computational prediction of complex cationic rearrangement outcomes

  • Tomasz Klucznik
  • Leonidas-Dimitrios Syntrivanis
  • Bartosz A. Grzybowski
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Single-cell, whole-embryo phenotyping of mammalian developmental disorders (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Single-cell, whole-embryo phenotyping of mammalian developmental disorders

A study reports single-cell RNA-sequencing profiles for more than 1.6 million cell nuclei from 101 whole mouse embryos including 22 mutant and 4 wild-type genotypes, from one experiment.

  • Xingfan Huang
  • Jana Henck
  • Malte Spielmann
ArticleOpen Access15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Bacterial cGAS senses a viral RNA to initiate immunity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Bacterial cGAS senses a viral RNA to initiate immunity

Staphylococcus CdnE03 cyclase recognizes structured RNA molecules produced by staphylococcal phages, triggering cyclic oligonucleotide production and, thereby, bacterial cell deatha mechanism of antiviral defence conserved across domains of life.

  • Dalton V. Banh
  • Cameron G. Roberts
  • Luciano A. Marraffini
ArticleOpen Access15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Imaging inter-valley coherent order in magic-angle twisted trilayer graphene (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Imaging inter-valley coherent order in magic-angle twisted trilayer graphene

Scanning tunnelling microscopy imaging of the correlated phases of magic-angle twisted trilayer graphene shows marked signatures of interaction-driven spatial symmetry breaking.

  • Hyunjin Kim
  • Youngjoon Choi
  • Stevan Nadj-Perge
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: The social and structural architecture of the yeast protein interactome (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The social and structural architecture of the yeast protein interactome

A protein interaction network constructed with data from high-throughput affinity enrichment coupled to mass spectrometry provides a highly saturated yeast interactome with 31,004 interactions, including low-abundance complexes, membrane protein complexes and non-taggable protein complexes.

  • Andr C. Michaelis
  • Andreas-David Brunner
  • Matthias Mann
ArticleOpen Access15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Kinetic magnetism in triangular moir materials (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Kinetic magnetism in triangular moir materials

Minimization of kinetic energy leads to ferromagnetic correlations between itinerant electrons in MoSe2/WS2 moir lattices even in the absence of exchange interactions.

  • L. Ciorciaro
  • T. Smoleski
  • A. mamolu
ArticleOpen Access15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Embryo-scale reverse genetics at single-cell resolution (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Embryo-scale reverse genetics at single-cell resolution

We present the zebrafish single-cell atlas of perturbed embryos, single-cell trancriptomic data of developing zebrafish embryos across various timepoints and with genetic perturbations.

  • Lauren M. Saunders
  • Sanjay R. Srivatsan
  • Cole Trapnell
ArticleOpen Access15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Minutes-duration optical flares with supernova luminosities (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Minutes-duration optical flares with supernova luminosities

Observations of optical flares from AT2022tsd (the Tasmanian Devil) show that they have durations on the timescale of minutes, occur over a period of months, are highly energetic, are probably nonthermal and have supernova luminosities.

  • Anna Y. Q. Ho
  • Daniel A. Perley
  • WeiKang Zheng
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: CD201+ fascia progenitors choreograph injury repair (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
CD201+ fascia progenitors choreograph injury repair

Spatiotemporal regulation of wound healing in mice and humans occurs via retinoic acid and hypoxia signalling, which regulate the differentiation of CD201+ fibroblast progenitors into proinflammatory and myofibroblast states.

  • Donovan Correa-Gallegos
  • Haifeng Ye
  • Yuval Rinkevich
ArticleOpen Access15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Quantumgas mixtures and dual-species atom interferometry in space (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Quantum gas mixtures and dual-species atom interferometry in space

Using upgraded hardware of the multiuser Cold Atom Lab (CAL) aboard the International Space Station (ISS), BoseEinstein condensates (BECs) of two atomic isotopes are simultaneously created and used to demonstrate interspecies interactions and dual species atom interferometry in space.

  • Ethan R. Elliott
  • David C. Aveline
  • Jason R. Williams
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Potentiating glymphatic drainage minimizes post-traumatic cerebral oedema (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Potentiating glymphatic drainage minimizes post-traumatic cerebral oedema

Acute oedema after traumatic brain injury is accompanied by the suppression of glymphatic and lymphatic fluid flow due to excessive systemic release of noradrenaline.

  • Rashad Hussain
  • Jeffrey Tithof
  • Maiken Nedergaard
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Dynamic diagnosis of metamaterials through laser-induced vibrational signatures (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Dynamic diagnosis of metamaterials through laser-induced vibrational signatures

A high-throughput, non-contact framework is described that uses the laser-induced vibrational signatures of metamaterials to non-destructively quantify their omnidirectional elastic information, dynamic linear properties, damping properties and defects.

  • Yun Kai
  • Somayajulu Dhulipala
  • Carlos M. Portela
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Quasi-experimental evaluation of a nationwide diabetes prevention programme (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Quasi-experimental evaluation of a nationwide diabetes prevention programme

Analysis of the largest behaviour change programme for prediabetes globally provides causal evidence that lifestyle advice and counselling implemented at scale can improve key cardiovascular risk factors.

  • Julia M. Lemp
  • Christian Bommer
  • Pascal Geldsetzer
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Illuminating protein space with a programmable generative model (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Illuminating protein space with a programmable generative model

Evolution has produced a range of diverse proteins, and now a generative model called Chroma can expand that set by allowing the user to design new proteins and protein complexes with desired properties and functions.

  • John B. Ingraham
  • Max Baranov
  • Gevorg Grigoryan
ArticleOpen Access15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Aligned grains and scattered light found in gaps of planet-forming disk (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Aligned grains and scattered light found in gaps of planet-forming disk

Deep, high-resolution polarization observations of HL Tau at 870m show gaps that have polarization angles with a notable azimuthal component and a higher polarization fraction than the rings.

  • Ian W. Stephens
  • Zhe-Yu Daniel Lin
  • Ryo Tazaki
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Stress granules plug and stabilize damaged endolysosomal membranes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Stress granules plug and stabilize damaged endolysosomal membranes

Stress granules function at sites of intracellular membrane damage by forming on and stabilizing the ruptured membrane and promoting membrane repair.

  • Claudio Bussi
  • Agustn Mangiarotti
  • Maximiliano G. Gutierrez
ArticleOpen Access15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Single-cell CRISPR screens in vivo map T cell fate regulomes in cancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Single-cell CRISPR screens in vivo map T cell fate regulomes in cancer

Analyses of causal gene regulatory networks have identified key checkpoints mediating the progressive differentiation of CD8+ cytotoxic T cells, findings that have implications for anticancer immunotherapies such as adoptive cell therapy and immune checkpoint blockade.

  • Peipei Zhou
  • Hao Shi
  • Hongbo Chi
ArticleOpen Access15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Clostridioides difficile ferrosome organelles combat nutritional immunity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Clostridioides difficile ferrosome organelles combat nutritional immunity

Ferrosome organelles produced by Clostridioides difficile are required to support colonization of the inflamed gut, highlighting the potential of targeting ferrosome formation as an antimicrobial strategy against this important pathogen.

  • Hualiang Pi
  • Rong Sun
  • Eric P. Skaar
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Ultralow-resistance electrochemical capacitor for integrable line filtering (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Ultralow-resistance electrochemical capacitor for integrable line filtering

A miniaturized narrow-channel in-plane electrochemical capacitor shows drastically reduced ionic resistances within both the electrode material and the electrolyte and an ultrahigh areal capacitance by downscaling the channel width with femtosecond-laser scribing.

  • Yajie Hu
  • Mingmao Wu
  • Liangti Qu
Article15 Nov 2023
